definition: a horse cannot get fat without an extra ration, a man cannot get rich without an extra income (idiom)
pinyin: ma3 wu2 ye4 cao3 bu4 fei2 , ren2 wu2 wai4 kuai4 bu4 fu4
containing_words.word: 馬無夜草不肥，人無外快不富

sentences.english: I also wrote articales for newspapers and journals , to make some extra money.
sentences.chinese: 並且爲報刊撰稿賺取外快。

sentences.english: There were also lots of street vendors trying to make some extra money during this festivity .
sentences.chinese: 這裏還有許多想趁着這個節日掙點外快的街頭小販。

sentences.english: She moonlights as a dancer in a hotel.
sentences.chinese: 她下班後在一家酒店跳舞賺外快。

sentences.english: He teaches in a middle school, bur do some translation work on the side to earn some extra money.
sentences.chinese: 他在中學教書，但是兼職做些翻譯來賺取外快。

sentences.english: He moonlighted as a driver after work in the past year.
sentences.chinese: 過去一年裏他靠下班後開車賺外快。

sentences.english: Eric earned his bread and butter as a bookkeeper, but added a little jam by working with a dance band on weekends.
sentences.chinese: 簿記員來維持生計，且利用週末當舞會伴奏賺些外快。

sentences.english: Contact these local IT consultancies if you’re seeking extra income.
sentences.chinese: 如果想找外快，跟這些本地的IT諮詢商聯繫吧。

sentences.english: These three methods will pay you, if you are serious about earning extra cash flow.
sentences.chinese: 如果你當真想賺些外快的話，這三種方法還是可行的。

sentences.english: I work there one night a week for the extra income.
sentences.chinese: 我在那兒一週工作一個晚上賺外快。

sentences.english: Freelancing is my dad's way of making some extra money on the side.
sentences.chinese: 撰稿是我父親爲撈些外快而做的兼職。

definition: to make a profit/to earn a packet
to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
